newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egyptian Gulf Bank raises capital to $100 mln.
newsitem.headline: Egyptian Gulf Bank raises capital to $100 mln.

text.p: Egyptian Gulf Bank said in a statement published on Monday it was doubling its authorised capital to $100 million from $50 million.

The statement said the bank took the decision at a shareholders' meeting on June 21. A report published in Al-Akhbar said the increase would be attained by offering existing shareholders 14.5 million shares while employees would be offered 500,000 shares. The shares are worth a nominal $2.
The report said the capital increase would take place in three phases and end in 1998. It added that the bank would also offer the public 10 million shares but at their market value.

The statement said paid-up and subscribed capital was $40 million divided into 20 million shares, with a nominal value of $2 each. Paid-up capital was 84.959 million pounds ($25 million) at the end of 1996.

Results for the first quarter of calendar 1997, the bank's financial year, showed total assets were worth 1.6 billion pounds and shareholders funds of 137.9 million. Distributable profits were 17 million pounds.
